item.title: Do You Need a Content Delivery Network?
item.description:
The way we deliver content online is evolving rapidly. While you could once manage a website with just a computer and a few phone lines, today’s high-definition video and nationwide audiences demand far more resources. This is where content delivery networks (CDNs) come in. Think of a CDN as a specialized web hosting service. Just as you can host your website on your own server or outsource it, you can also choose between managing your content distribution or relying on a CDN...

item.title: Yes, You Can Afford a Content Delivery Network
item.description:
The internet is great for communication, allowing businesses to connect with anyone globally at a low cost and creating countless opportunities. However, this popularity has led to congestion, potentially slowing down websites. You can work around this issue without sacrificing connectivity. Large content providers use Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) to bypass internet congestion. CDNs don’t connect directly to users but deliver content through servers near service providers, resulting in faster speeds...
